Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Stereotactic Radiosurgery in Facilitating Microsurgical Resection of Brain Arteriovenous Malformations

Trial_Design.evidence: In this randomised controlled trial, 42 patients with AVMs were recruited

Participants.evidence: 42 patients with AVMs were recruited at the University of California, San Francisco, between 1997 and 2007

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned to receive either prior RS (RS+) or no RS (RSâˆ’) before microsurgical resection

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the change in modified Rankin Scale (mRS) scores, assessed postoperatively

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence, and allocation was concealed using sealed envelopes

Blinding.evidence: Outcome assessors were blinded to group allocation

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 21 patients were randomised to each group

Result_Outcome.evidence: Mean AVM volume was reduced by 78% in the RS+ group (P<0.01), and Spetzler-Martin grades decreased in 52% of RS+ patients (P<0.001)

Harms.evidence: RS+ patients experienced deterioration due to hemorrhages during the latency period (P<0.05)
